| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | [dNAO 3.21.1 src/monst.c, line 8183](https://github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/dNAO/blob/compat-3.21.1/src/monst.c#L8183) |

**A'gone**, @, is a [unique monster](/wiki/Unique_monster "Unique monster") that appears in the [Drow Noble quest](/wiki/Drow_Noble_quest "Drow Noble quest") of [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). She is a [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(monster\) "Drow (monster)") that "guards" the [Drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble")'s [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), the [Web of the Chosen](/wiki/Web_of_the_Chosen "Web of the Chosen").

A'gone was the rival of the Drow Noble player character, selected by [Lolth](/wiki/Lolth_\(dNetHack\) "Lolth (dNetHack)") to be her Chosen priestess - she was originally sent by a rival to the character's [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader") and [mother](/wiki/Mother "Mother") to discover the cause of sudden silence within a life-cavern colony previously used for food production. A'gone failed and was captured by the [mind flayers](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") that had taken over; her mind was [subsequently destroyed](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless"), and she was imprisoned in a cell near the dwelling of the colony's [elder brain](/wiki/Elder_brain "Elder brain").

## Generation

A'gone is imprisoned within one of the cells on the edge of the Drow Noble quest's goal level, with unbreakable [iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars") blocking off access.

## Strategy

As the [umber hulks](/wiki/Umber_hulk "Umber hulk") around the level cannot dig into the cells, characters will need a [force bolt](/wiki/Force_bolt "Force bolt") spell or a [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking") to break the iron bars of A'gone's cell; this may be best to do after disposing of the elder brain guarding the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening"). A'gone herself is not only mindless, but completely harmless as well - her sole "attack" in the code is a 0d0 [grabbing attack](/wiki/Grabbing_attack "Grabbing attack") which cannot be used, and her only defenses are her 60 [MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") and [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"). Once the more pressing threats are dealt with, there is little else to do beyond quickly putting A'gone out of her misery and retrieving the artifact.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
A'gone

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ A'gone (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks Bearhug 0d0 physical
@ A'gone (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks

Bearhug 0d0 physical

Base level 14
Base experience 390
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 60
Alignment -9 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 800
Nutritional value 350
Size medium
Resistances sleep, petrification
Resistances conveyed sleep

A'gone:

  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is an overlord to its kind.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • waits for you to come.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • may turn against you when tame.
  • cannot be tamed.
Reference dNAO 3.21.1 src/monst.c, line 8183

A'gone, @, is a unique monster that appears in the Drow Noble quest of dNetHack and notdNetHack. She is a drow that "guards" the Drow Noble's quest artifact, the Web of the Chosen.

A'gone was the rival of the Drow Noble player character, selected by Lolth to be her Chosen priestess - she was originally sent by a rival to the character's quest leader and mother to discover the cause of sudden silence within a life-cavern colony previously used for food production. A'gone failed and was captured by the mind flayers that had taken over; her mind was subsequently destroyed, and she was imprisoned in a cell near the dwelling of the colony's elder brain.

Generation

A'gone is imprisoned within one of the cells on the edge of the Drow Noble quest's goal level, with unbreakable iron bars blocking off access.

Strategy

As the umber hulks around the level cannot dig into the cells, characters will need a force bolt spell or a wand of striking to break the iron bars of A'gone's cell; this may be best to do after disposing of the elder brain guarding the Bell of Opening. A'gone herself is not only mindless, but completely harmless as well - her sole "attack" in the code is a 0d0 grabbing attack which cannot be used, and her only defenses are her 60 MR and sleep resistance. Once the more pressing threats are dealt with, there is little else to do beyond quickly putting A'gone out of her misery and retrieving the artifact.

'''A'gone''', {{magenta|@}}, is a [[unique monster]] that appears in the [[Drow Noble quest]] of [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. She is a [[Drow (monster)|drow]] that "guards" the [[Drow (starting race)|Drow]] [[Noble]]'s [[quest artifact]], the [[Web of the Chosen]].

A'gone was the rival of the Drow Noble player character, selected by [[Lolth (dNetHack)|Lolth]] to be her Chosen priestess - she was originally sent by a rival to the character's [[quest leader]] and [[mother]] to discover the cause of sudden silence within a life-cavern colony previously used for food production. A'gone failed and was captured by the [[mind flayer]]s that had taken over; her mind was [[mindless|subsequently destroyed]], and she was imprisoned in a cell near the dwelling of the colony's [[elder brain]].

==Generation==
A'gone is imprisoned within one of the cells on the edge of the Drow Noble quest's goal level, with unbreakable [[iron bars]] blocking off access.

==Strategy==
As the [[umber hulk]]s around the level cannot dig into the cells, characters will need a [[force bolt]] spell or a [[wand of striking]] to break the iron bars of A'gone's cell; this may be best to do after disposing of the elder brain guarding the [[Bell of Opening]]. A'gone herself is not only mindless, but completely harmless as well - her sole "attack" in the code is a 0d0 [[grabbing attack]] which cannot be used, and her only defenses are her 60 [[magic resistance (monster)|MR]] and [[sleep resistance]]. Once the more pressing threats are dealt with, there is little else to do beyond quickly putting A'gone out of her misery and retrieving the artifact.
{{variant-343}}
